response: Hi. I guess... the dinner was kind of rough. When my husband said that thing about me exaggerating my work, I just felt this sinking feeling, like everyone was looking at me differently. I tried not to say much after that, but inside, I was just so ashamed. It’s like no matter what I do, it’s never good enough for him or maybe even for my family.

Um, hi. I guess… this week was okay, but there was this one dinner with my family that felt kind of rough. I tried to tell Mark about my promotion, but he kept interrupting and talking about his work instead. I didn’t really say much after that because it just felt like what I had to say didn’t matter. I don’t know, maybe I’m just being too sensitive.

Um, hi. I guess... this week was kind of tough. At the workshop, I felt like everyone else was just so much quicker to get things, and I was stuck trying to keep up. It was embarrassing, really. I don’t know, maybe I’m just not cut out for this kind of work.

I guess it’s been really hard since that meeting. I keep replaying what my boss said, and it just feels like I can’t do anything right. I’m worried everyone thinks I’m not capable, and honestly, it’s exhausting trying to fix everything all the time. Sometimes I just want to avoid the meetings altogether because I’m scared of more criticism. It’s like no matter what I do, I’m not good enough.

I guess... last week was really hard. My daughter said I was too controlling in front of everyone, and it just crushed me. I kept thinking, maybe I'm just messing everything up for them. After that, I just kind of shut down and stayed away from the family for a while. Then I tried to be nicer, like, too nice, almost like I was scared they'd hate me if I wasn’t.

Yeah, I guess... I just can’t stop thinking about that mistake I made. It feels like I’m a complete failure, you know? Like I’m the one who’s always messing up while everyone else is moving forward. I keep worrying that my boss will find out and I’ll lose my job. It’s hard to shake off the feeling that I’m just not good enough.

Hi, I guess… it’s been a rough week. That family reunion was harder than I thought. When my sister said that about her kids being better behaved, I just felt… awful. Like I’m failing completely as a mother. I ended up just staying quiet the rest of the time.

Hi. I guess… the meeting didn’t go very well. I had some ideas I thought were good, but they just brushed them off. It made me feel like I’m not really taken seriously here. I don’t know, maybe I’m just not cut out for this.

Hi. I guess… it’s been a tough week. The rent increase notice really hit me hard. I’ve been trying to cut back on everything, even the little things, but it feels like no matter what I do, it’s never enough. I keep thinking, how am I going to keep my kids safe and fed if this keeps up? It’s just overwhelming.

...I guess the workshop didn’t go well. I just froze when they asked questions. It felt like everyone was watching me mess up. I didn’t want to say anything else after that. Sometimes I wonder if I’m just not cut out for this kind of work.

I guess... I just feel kind of stuck. I thought I was doing everything right, putting in the hours, meeting deadlines, but then not getting the promotion just makes me wonder if it’s all pointless. It’s like, maybe I’m just not cut out for this. I don’t know, I try not to think about it too much, but it’s hard.

Hi, I’m not really sure where to start. The family dinner last week was... tough. When my mom criticized my choice to keep working, I just felt so small and like I was failing everyone. I ended up just shutting down and not saying much after that. I don’t know, it’s like I’m always trying to prove I’m doing enough, but maybe I never really am.

Hi. I guess... that family dinner was harder than I thought it would be. When my sister made that comment about my kids, I just felt... really small, like I wasn’t measuring up. It’s like no matter what I do, it’s never enough. I don’t know, maybe I’m just not cut out for this parenting thing.

I guess... I just feel kind of stuck. It’s like no matter how much I try, it’s never enough. I don’t really know why they chose someone else over me. I just feel like maybe I’m not really cut out for this. It’s hard to even want to try for anything new now.

Hi. I guess it’s been a rough week. I don’t really see the point in talking about it much. I was passed over for that promotion again, and it just feels like I’m not good enough. Everyone else seems to get ahead except me.

Hi. Um, I guess the meeting was... okay. I suggested an idea, but no one really seemed to care about it. It felt like they just wanted to move on quickly, like what I said didn’t matter. I don’t know, maybe I didn’t explain it well enough.

Hi. I guess... the meeting was kind of frustrating. I tried to say something about the project, but people just kept talking over me. It felt like they weren’t really paying attention. I don’t know, maybe it’s just me.

Yeah, it was really frustrating. I mean, I get that the delay wasn’t ideal, but it felt like my boss just ignored all the times I’ve done well and focused only on that one mistake. It’s hard not to take it personally, you know? I keep thinking, maybe I’m just not cut out for this job after all.

Hi. I guess the workshop was... okay. I mean, I struggled a bit with some of the new stuff, but maybe that's normal? Everyone else seemed to get it faster, though. I’m not sure if I’m just slower or if I’m missing something.

Um, I guess... at the dinner party, I just felt kind of invisible? Like, Tom was really into talking with everyone else, and I was just there. It made me think maybe I wasn’t interesting enough for him or for the others. I tried to smile and join in, but it felt like I was just faking it. I don’t know, maybe I’m just overthinking it.

Yeah, I guess the family reunion was kind of tough for me. I tried to tell them about my new job, but no one really seemed interested. It felt like they just kept talking over me or ignoring what I said. I don’t know, maybe I’m just not worth listening to. It’s frustrating, but I don’t really see how that’s going to change.

Yeah, I guess the family reunion was... rough. I overheard my siblings making jokes about my past business failures. It just reminded me of how I've always felt like the odd one out, like the one who just can’t get it right. I didn’t really want to stick around after that. It’s like no matter what I do, I’m just the “underachiever” in their eyes.

Hi. I guess... last week was kind of rough at work. My manager pointed out some mistakes in the report I was responsible for, and it just made me feel... I don’t know, like maybe I’m not cut out for this role. I’ve been trying to fix everything, but I still worry it’s not enough. It’s hard to shake off the feeling that I’m letting everyone down.

Yeah, I guess I’ve been pretty stressed out at work lately. My supervisor told me my last report wasn’t up to standard, and now I can’t stop thinking that maybe I’m just not cut out for this job. Even though I’ve had good reviews before, this one comment feels like it’s all anyone sees. I’ve been staying late, trying to fix everything, but it just makes me more anxious. Honestly, I’m worried I’m going to mess up so badly that I’ll end up alone, like always.

I guess... at the dinner party, when I saw Tom laughing with his coworker, I just felt this knot in my stomach. It was like, immediately, I thought he must find her more interesting than me. I kept trying to get his attention, asking him if he still found me attractive, but it felt like I was just embarrassing myself. I know it sounds silly, but I couldn’t help feeling jealous and kind of worthless. Maybe I’m just too sensitive.

Hi. Yeah, the team event was... okay, I guess. I tried to join in with some people, but they just kind of smiled briefly and then went back to their own conversation. It made me feel like I wasn’t really welcome or wanted there. I don't know, maybe I was just imagining it.

Yeah, I guess... It just felt like John wasn’t really paying attention to me at all. I don’t know, maybe I’m just overthinking it. It’s hard to explain, but I just felt kind of invisible at the dinner.

Hi. I guess this week was pretty rough after that meeting with my supervisor. I can’t stop thinking about how she criticized my project in front of everyone. It just felt... humiliating, like I really messed up big time. I keep worrying that everyone now sees me as incapable.

Um, I guess the dinner was... okay, but I don’t really want to talk about it much. It’s just the same old stuff, you know? My sister’s comments really got to me, but I’m not sure what difference it makes to say anything about it. I just ended up feeling kind of... useless.

Um, I guess… it’s been kind of hard this past week. I noticed my partner hasn’t been as open about where they’ve been, and it’s been making me feel… I don’t know, uneasy. I keep wondering if they’re choosing to spend time with someone else because I’m just not interesting enough. I find myself checking their phone sometimes, even though I don’t want to. It just feels like I’m waiting for them to prove me wrong, but they never do.

Um, yeah, so last week there was this work social event... I tried to join a group of colleagues who were talking about a project. But when I came closer, they kind of stopped and looked at each other before going back to their conversation. It felt like they didn’t want me there. I guess it just made me feel... left out and kind of sad.

Yeah, I guess... I just feel like no matter how much I try, it’s never enough. That email from the client this morning really hit me hard. It’s like they see through me, like I’m not just bad at my job but something worse. I don’t know, maybe I just mess everything up, and it’s only a matter of time before everyone realizes it. I’ve been keeping to myself a lot at work lately because I don’t want to cause any more problems.

Um, I guess… it was kind of hard to hear that from my boss. I mean, I usually do my best to keep everything on track. But this time, I missed that deadline, and it just feels like maybe I’m not good enough after all. I keep thinking, what if everyone thinks I’m just messing things up? It’s hard not to feel… disappointed in myself.

Um, hi. I guess... this week was kind of tough. That meeting, where my proposal got criticized... it really stuck with me. I keep thinking maybe I’m just not cut out for this leadership stuff. I don’t know, it’s hard to shake off that feeling.

I… I guess I noticed my paycheck was less than I expected this week. It’s just frustrating because I thought I had everything under control, but this kind of thing makes me feel like I’m failing. I haven’t really wanted to check my account since then. I just don’t know if I’m managing anything right.

Hi. I guess... this past week has been really tough. I found out that one of my projects went way over budget, and I can't stop thinking about how I messed up. It just feels like everyone’s going to see me as incompetent, like I don’t deserve the promotion. I’ve been avoiding making any financial decisions since then because I’m scared I’ll just make more mistakes. Honestly, I’m not sure if I can handle all this responsibility.

Yeah, I guess... it’s been a tough week. I keep thinking about that mistake I made with the tax return, and I just can’t shake the feeling that I’m going to lose my job. I’ve been checking everything I do over and over, but it doesn’t seem to help. Honestly, I’m just scared that everyone at work is talking about how incompetent I am. It’s like no matter what I do, it’s never going to be good enough.

Yeah, I guess... that comment at dinner really stuck with me. It just made me feel like I’m failing my kids somehow, like I’m not measuring up to what a “good” parent should be. I keep thinking maybe everyone else sees me the same way now. It’s hard not to take it personally, you know? Sometimes I just want to avoid those family gatherings altogether.

Uh, I guess the workshop didn’t go very well for me. I kept falling behind, and it felt like everyone else was picking it up so much faster. I’m not sure why I even tried to keep up; it just made me feel... worse. I ended up sitting quietly, not really talking much. It’s like I was just waiting for the whole thing to be over.

Yeah, I guess… it’s been tough this past week. I haven’t really looked at my investment accounts because, honestly, I’m scared of what I’ll find. It just feels like no matter what I do, I’m going to mess it up again. I don’t know if I can really handle this financial stuff, and I’m worried I’m letting my family down.

Hi. I guess this week was... okay, I suppose. The meeting with my manager was tough, though. I felt like everyone was looking at me like I messed up big time. I tried to prepare more for the next meeting, but I’m not sure if it helped.

I guess... at the dinner party, I just noticed John seemed, uh, more into talking with that coworker than with me. It made me feel kind of... I don’t know, maybe like I wasn’t interesting enough? I didn't really say much after that, just kind of kept to myself. I don’t know if it means much, but it stuck with me.

Hi. Yeah, I guess this week was tough. I had that proposal rejected again, which feels like... I don’t know, like I’m just not cut out for this job. It’s hard to shake off the feeling that maybe I’m just... useless here. Sorry, I’m not really sure what else to say.

Hi. I guess... I’m feeling pretty down about what happened at the family dinner last week. I tried to share my promotion, but no one really seemed to care. It just felt like they were more interested in talking about my brother again, like always. I don’t know, it just reminded me of how I always feel overlooked.

Hi. I guess the week hasn't been great. At work, we found out there won’t be any bonuses this year because the company is struggling financially. I can’t help but think that maybe I’m just not good enough, that I’m not doing enough to deserve it. It’s been really hard not to feel... well, disappointed and kind of ashamed, I guess.

Yeah, I guess... it’s just hard to talk about. I don’t know, sometimes it feels like no one really wants to hear what I have to say. Like at work, I tried to share an idea, but people just talked over me, and I just shut down after that. I’m not sure if it’s me or if they’re just not interested. It’s frustrating, but I don’t really expect it to be different.

Uh, hi. I guess... I don’t really know where to start. The meeting was, um, rough. My manager didn’t seem to like my ideas at all, and it felt like everyone was just waiting for me to mess up. I’ve been thinking about it a lot since then.

Hi. I guess... the meeting was tough for me. When my boss said my presentation lacked depth, I just felt... like I really messed up. I keep thinking maybe I’m not cut out for this job. It’s hard to shake off that feeling.

(As XXX) Uh, I guess... I’ve been feeling pretty anxious about that mistake I made at work. I keep thinking that I’m just bad at my job and that I’m going to mess everything up for everyone. I’ve been trying to check everything over and over, but it doesn’t seem to help much. It’s hard to even talk about it.

Um, yeah, I guess… at lunch the other day, I tried to say something about that new TV show everyone’s been watching. But, um, no one really responded, and then they just started talking about something else. It felt like I wasn’t even there, like I was invisible. I don’t know… maybe I just shouldn’t try to join in next time.

I guess it was frustrating. I tried to say something, but it felt like nobody was really listening. I just ended up quiet for the rest of the meeting. It’s like what I say doesn’t really matter to them. Maybe my ideas just aren’t worth sharing.

Hi. I guess... I just don’t know if it’s worth talking about things sometimes. Like, when I brought up the idea of going to Europe for vacation, he just brushed it off like it was some silly fantasy. It made me feel kind of invisible, like my thoughts don’t really matter. I don’t even know if I should bother sharing what I want anymore.

Hi. I guess... this week’s been pretty overwhelming. I got that notice about the rent increase, and honestly, it feels like everything’s just piling up. I keep thinking I’m messing up my kids’ lives because I can’t get this money stuff right. I’m trying to cut back on things, but it’s hard, and I don’t really want to talk about it with anyone.

...I guess it was just frustrating. I thought maybe this time they'd actually listen, but it felt like they just brushed me off again. I don’t know, maybe I’m just not cut out for this kind of work. It’s hard to explain.

I guess the week was pretty rough. When they told me the deadline was moved up, I just felt... overwhelmed, like I was already behind even though I hadn’t started the new timeline. I kept thinking, "I’m never going to finish this on time," and it made me anxious all day. I tried to work nonstop, but I kept getting distracted and then felt guilty for not doing enough. Honestly, it just felt like I wasn’t cut out for this job.

Hi. I guess this week was rough. I overheard my partner laughing on the phone, and he said something like, "You know how she can be." It just really got to me. I felt like maybe he was talking about my flaws again, like I’m not good enough or something.

Hi. I guess this past week was pretty rough. I spent a lot of time just... worrying after my boss pointed out mistakes in my presentation. I kept thinking, maybe I just can't do anything right no matter how hard I try. It’s exhausting, honestly.

Hi. I guess the family dinner didn’t go well again. It’s just... every time my sister says something, I end up feeling like I’m the joke of the evening. I don’t know, it’s like no matter what I do, it’s never enough for them. I just shut down and try not to make things worse.

Hi. I guess… I’m not really sure where to start. It’s just been hard at work since I didn’t get that promotion. I keep thinking maybe they’re right, and I’m just not good enough. I’ve been avoiding talking to my team and putting off starting new projects because I’m scared I’ll mess up again. It’s like no matter what I do, it’s never enough.

Hi, I guess... this week was pretty stressful. When I got that email from my boss asking for the report so suddenly, I just froze. I kept thinking that I would mess it up and everyone would see that I’m not capable of handling my job. I ended up avoiding starting it because I felt so overwhelmed, and honestly, I just wanted to hide from everyone at work. It’s like this fear takes over, and I don’t know how to shake it off.

Hi. I guess... last week was really hard. My partner didn’t even mention our anniversary, and it just felt like... I don’t know, like I don’t matter to him at all. I kept thinking maybe he’s just going to leave me one day, and there’s nothing I can do about it. It’s hard to shake off that feeling.

Hi. I guess the meeting was... okay, but I don’t really know. I mean, when I suggested that idea, it just felt like no one really wanted to hear it. Maybe it wasn’t good enough. I don’t know, I just kind of kept quiet after that.

Hi, um, I guess the family dinner was... okay, I suppose. I tried to say something about work, but it felt like no one really wanted to listen. I didn’t really feel like pushing to talk after a while. It’s probably nothing, really.

Uh, I guess I’ve been avoiding dealing with the audit stuff. It just feels overwhelming, and I keep thinking maybe I messed up somewhere even though I try to be careful. I don’t really want to talk about it much; it’s just stressful. I don’t know, maybe I’m just not good enough to handle this.

Hi. I guess the meeting was… okay, but I don’t know. I just felt like maybe my idea wasn’t really worth much since no one seemed interested. It’s hard to say if it was just a bad day or if that’s how it usually goes. I didn’t really want to say much after that.

Well, the meeting was kind of frustrating. I tried to say something, but people just talked over me like I wasn’t even there. It’s like my ideas don’t matter, so I just kept quiet after that. I guess it’s easier not to bother trying.

...I guess, I just noticed he’s been going out more lately, and I didn’t really ask why. It’s been bothering me, but I don’t know if it’s worth making a big deal out of. Maybe I’m just overthinking things. It’s hard to explain.

Hi. I guess... I’ve been feeling pretty overwhelmed lately, especially with money stuff. I got that overdraft notice from the bank, and it just made me feel like I’m messing everything up. I’m not sure if I’m handling this the right way. It’s hard to talk about it without feeling... embarrassed.

Yeah, it's been really tough this past week. When they told me the deadline got moved up, I just felt this sinking feeling, like no matter how hard I try, I’m just not good enough to handle this. I’ve been staying late every night, trying to catch up, but it feels like I’m just spinning my wheels. I keep thinking everyone must be noticing how overwhelmed I am and that I’m not cut out for this job. Honestly, it’s exhausting, and I’m starting to wonder if I’m just fooling myself.

Well, I guess… the meeting didn’t really go well. I suggested something, but it felt like no one really cared. It’s like my ideas just don’t matter to them. I don’t know, maybe I just didn’t explain it right.

Yeah, I guess it’s been a rough week. The pay cut just hit me hard, you know? I keep thinking that maybe I’m not good enough, that I’m failing my family. It’s like no matter what I do, I can’t shake this feeling that they’ll end up leaving me. I’ve been working longer hours, but it just feels like it’s never enough.

Yeah, it was... kind of frustrating. I tried to say something about my promotion, but it felt like no one really cared. They just moved on to talking about my brother’s business like it was way more important. I don’t know, it just made me feel like whatever I do doesn’t matter much to them.

Hi. I guess the family reunion was… okay, I suppose. It’s just, well, when I tried to talk about my promotion, no one really seemed interested. My parents quickly started talking about my brother’s business instead. It made me feel kind of invisible, like what I have to say doesn’t really matter.

Hi. Yeah, this week was... tough. I got this unexpected bill for my car repair, and it just piled on top of my rent due. I guess I felt pretty overwhelmed and, honestly, kind of like I’m just bad at managing money. I kept putting off looking at my bank account because I didn’t want to face it.

I guess this past week has been pretty tough. When my manager said the timeline was unrealistic, I just felt... like maybe I'm not cut out for this job. I kept thinking everyone must be doubting my abilities now. I found myself going over the project details again and again, just to make sure I didn't miss anything. Honestly, I even started avoiding some meetings because I was scared of more criticism.

I don’t know, it just made me feel like no matter what I do, I’m always going to be in his shadow. But maybe I’m just overthinking it.
Hi, I guess. I’m not really sure what to say. Things have been... tough at work lately. I keep messing up, and it feels like I can’t do anything right. I don’t know if I can keep this up.

Hi. I guess... this week has been tough. That meeting with my manager really stuck with me. I keep thinking that maybe I’m just not cut out for this role, you know? It’s hard to shake off the feeling that I’m going to mess everything up.

Hi. I guess I’m feeling a bit… stuck. At work, during the team meeting, I suggested an idea, but no one really seemed to listen. It just made me feel kind of invisible, like my thoughts don’t matter. I don’t know, maybe I’m just overthinking it.

Hi. I guess, this past week was... okay, I suppose. I didn't really push myself much, though. I ended up avoiding a few calls with some colleagues and didn’t sign up for that training session I was thinking about. It just felt like I wasn’t ready, or maybe I’m just not good enough to keep up.
